properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Karbethong, Lake View, Mallacoota. 
  • There is a bushfire at Mallacoota - Lake Barracoota that is contained.
  • Crews supported by aircraft are still working in the area. 
Parts of the Croajingolong National Park to the east of Mallacoota Inlet are closed including:

  • Lakeview Track 
  • Barracoota Link Track 
  • Howe Flat Track and Howe Flat walking track 
  • Cemetery Bight Day Visitor area and jetty 
  • Spotted Dog Mine walking track 
  • Brokewells Hut Jetty and Allans Head Day Visitor area and jetty
  • The Wilderness Coast to the east of Mallacoota is also temporarily closed.
DEECA will update VicTrack as the roads reopen.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Mallacoota - Lake Barracoota
Issue Date: Monday 02 February 2026, 04:03 pm
Next Update: Friday 06 February 2026, 03:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41089/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Karbethong, Lake View, Mallacoota. 
- There is a bushfire at Mallacoota - Lake Barracoota that is contained.
- Crews supported by aircraft are still working in the area. 

Parts of the Croajingolong National Park to the east of Mallacoota Inlet are closed including:

- Lakeview Track 
- Barracoota Link Track 
- Howe Flat Track and Howe Flat walking track 
- Cemetery Bight Day Visitor area and jetty 
- Spotted Dog Mine walking track 
- Brokewells Hut Jetty and Allans Head Day Visitor area and jetty
- The Wilderness Coast to the east of Mallacoota is also temporarily closed.

DEECA will update VicTrack as the roads reopen.

There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: between the townships of Kennedys Creek and Carlisle River
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for between the townships of Kennedys Creek and Carlisle River
  • This Advice replaces the Advice - Stay Informed issued at 3:32pm 03/02/2026.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Heavy machinery and aircraft continue to operate in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
Road closures:
  • Gellibrand - Carlisle Road east bound
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • All Forest and National Park Tracks and Roads within the impacted area are closed.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2026 03:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice is being issued for Gellibrand. 
  • The drinking water supply for Gellibrand has been re-established following recent bushfires in the area. 
  • The Do Not Drink advisory has been lifted.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at Monday 2 February 2026.
Tap water is safe to drink in Gellibrand.
What you should do: 
  • Turn on all of your taps and let the water run for at least two minutes before use. Doing this flushes out contaminated water. 
This message was issued by Department of Health.

The next update is expected by 06/02/2026 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - DRINKING WATER - Threat is Reduced
Incident Location: Gellibrand
Issue Date: Wednesday 04 February 2026, 02:58 pm
Next Update: Friday 06 February 2026, 10:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41125/moreinfo

This Advice is being issued for Gellibrand. 
- The drinking water supply for Gellibrand has been re-established following recent bushfires in the area. 
- The Do Not Drink advisory has been lifted.
- This Advice replaces the Advice issued at Monday 2 February 2026.


Tap water is safe to drink in Gellibrand.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Dargo, Waterford, Castleburn, Crooked River and surrounding areas
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dargo, Waterford, Castleburn, Crooked River and surrounding areas.
  • The bushfire at Wonnangatta Valley (known as the Wonnangatta - Dargo complex) is now under control.
  • Firefighters are onsite to continue extinguishment of any remaining hotspots.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 5:40 on 1 February.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family by visiting CFA Plan and Prepare
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Aircraft are operating in the area. 
  • Firefighters continue patrolling this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
For more information on Park closure updates check the Parks Victoria website and the Forest Fire Management website.

For Current Road closures check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2026 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook, Greendale, Lerderderg.
  • There is a bushfire at Greendale that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters have been able to slow the spread of the fire.
  • There is currently no threat to communities.
  • Firefighters with machinery and aircraft will continue to work on the fire overnight and tomorrow.
  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 2.46pm Wednesday 4 February 2026.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following road is closed: Obriens Road between Greendale-Trentham Rd and Bluegum Track.
  • The Lerderderg State Park is closed to all visitors including runners and walkers.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2026 10:40 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds.
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds. .
  • There is a bushfire at 27Km West Of Walwa that is contained.
  • The fire started in the Mt Lawson State Park on the 5th January and has spread through to the Wabba Wilderness Park. The fire is approximately 121,500 hectares.
  • The fire is now contained.
  • Storms and lightning have passed through the area this weekend. Potential for new fire starts are expected.
  • For the latest community newsletter Click HERE
  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 9:38am 2 February, 2026.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Murray Valley Highway is open.
  • The Benambra-Corryong Road is open.

  • The following parks within the Parks Victoria estate are currently closed to the public: Mount Lawson State Park, Pheasant Creek Flora Reserve, Mountain Creek Education Area, Granya Bushland Reserve, Beetooma Stream Side Reserve, Berringama Bushland Reserve, Wabba Wilderness Park. 
These closures are in place for public safety. To check for updates before planning your visit Click HERE

  • Emergency services, machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • Monitor air quality and take precautions to protect your health by visiting https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/ 
  • For localised mental health support please contact Albury Wodonga Health Mental Health Triage Line on 1300 104 211
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 08/02/2026 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: 27Km West Of Walwa Issue Date: Monday 02 February 2026, 06:55 pm Next Update: Sunday 08 February 2026, 12:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41078/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds. . - There is a bushfire at 27Km West Of Walwa that is contained. - The fire started in the Mt Lawson State Park on the 5th January and has spread through to the Wabba Wilderness Park. The fire is approximately 121,500 hectares. - The fire is now contained. - Storms and lightning have passed through the area this weekend. Potential for new fire starts are expected. - For the latest community newsletter Click HERE - This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 9:38am 2 February, 2026. There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.webHeadline: Today, Thu, 5 Feb 2026 has been declared a day of Total Fire Ban in the North East district(s) of Victoria.  No fires can be lit or be allowed to remain alight in the open air from 12:01 AM on Thu, 5 Feb 2026 until 11:59 PM Thu, 5 Feb 2026.
